title: 2023 Everyday AI Hackathon
text:
한국어 버전




You’ve worked hard, collaborated with your team, and developed something incredible. Now it’s time to show it to the world! Follow the steps below to submit your project for the Everyday AI Hackathon.

Submission Guidelines

Submission Period:

Projects can be submitted from October 20th to November 4th, 24:00. No submissions will be accepted after the deadline.

Project Format:

All projects must be hosted on Hugging Face Spaces.
Your project’s README.md should include a comprehensive overview, explaining the problem statement, solution, technologies used, and any other relevant information.

Team Information:

Clearly mention all team members’ names and roles.
Designate a team leader who’ll act as the primary contact point.




How to Submit

Fill Out the Submission Form:

Project Name: Choose a name that represents your project.
Project URL: Provide the link to your project hosted on Hugging Face Spaces.
Short Description: A brief overview of your project (max 200 words).
Team Members: List all members and their roles.
Contact Email: Provide the team leader’s email for correspondence.

Upload Additional Files (Optional):

If you have additional resources, documents, or slides that complement your project, upload them using the provided interface.

Review & Submit:

Ensure all information is accurate. Double-check URLs to ensure they’re working.
Click “Submit” to finalize your project submission.




Post-Submission
Once submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Projects will undergo a review, and shortlisted teams will be notified regarding the next steps.
Thank you for being a part of the Everyday AI Hackathon! We’re excited to see your innovations and wish all participants the best of luck. If you face any issues during submission, please contact us through the Discord #support channel.

 제출하기

title: 2023 Everyday AI Hackathon
text:
03_Contributions and Submissions
This phase marks a critical juncture where you can enhance the value of your project through community interaction and assessment processes. The hackathon represents a valuable opportunity to share and grow each other’s work, so your active participation is highly encouraged!

Contributing to a Project
Begin by visiting the Community tab of a project that piques your interest and click the New Pull Request button.

To clearly communicate your intended contributions, please concisely articulate an overview of your planned work in the commit message section of the new window that appears. This approach significantly eases the process of tracking project contribution histories later on.

As shown on the screen, proceed with clone, fetch, and checkout to set up your local environment for work.



Access Token Generation and Login Process
Subsequently, you’ll need to create an access token through your Hugging Face account and utilize it for login. This token plays a crucial role in authenticating and safeguarding your contributions. For detailed instructions, please refer to the English guide.

To verify a successful login, execute the huggingface-cli whoami command in your terminal.


Sharing Work and Committing
Commit important stages of your project as you progress, and push them to maintain continuous communication with the community. This process ensures the transparent sharing of your work’s ongoing progress.



Crafting a README
The project’s README file should be meticulously crafted to ensure that anyone can easily comprehend the project. It should provide ample information about the project, including its objectives, the technologies employed, key changes, among other pertinent details.


Hackathon and Evaluation Timeline
Following the submission of your project, there is a three-week period throughout the entire hackathon during which your project will be subject to community reviews and evaluations. During this phase, to uphold the caliber of the project and prevent any unfair practices, remember that each team must receive at least (number of team members + 2) ‘likes’ to be issued a completion certificate.

title: 02_프로젝트 생성
text:
02_Creating a Project
Let’s kickstart your journey through the hackathon! In this hackathon, you will have the opportunity to register your innovative ideas and projects in the Hugging Face KREW Hackathon 2023 collection, and share them with both the local and global audience via a wall of fame in our offline event and community blog post on Hugging Face.
"Hugging Face KREW Hackathon 2023" (collection)
    ├── ParticipantProject(1) (space)
    ├── ...
    ├── ParticipantProject(n-1) (model)
    └── ParticipantProject(n) (dataset)

Registering with Hugging Face
Before you begin, sign up with Hugging Face through this link: hf.co/join. Become part of a global community by completing a simple registration process.







Enrolling as a Pseudo Lab Contributor
After signing up, proceed to the Contributor Registration page and gain access to ‘Pseudo Lab’ projects. This platform is where your ideas will shine.







Directly Creating Your Project
Try creating a new Space by clicking the New button within the Pseudo Lab organization. For the Space name, use something representative of your project. In the license selection, we recommend the “Apache 2.0 License.”










Configuring your project for actual deployment is crucial. In the SDK options, we particularly recommend Gradio for beginners. It’s user-friendly, offering various examples for quick learning. While the basic free CPU resources are provided for hardware, you can request additional GPU resources if necessary. However, please make such requests only when essential, as all participants share these resources!












Using advanced GPU hardware resources will consume the overall hackathon Credit.
We request efficient usage with consideration for other participants.






Sharing in the Collection
Fantastic! Now that you’ve created a space for launching your project, you’re probably eager to introduce it to other participants. Let’s see how to link your project to the hackathon collection.





Click the ... button in the upper right corner and select Add to collection.





Choose Hugging Face KREW Hackathon 2023 (pseudolab) to add your project to the hackathon collection.


Importing an Existing Project
If you’ve already initiated a project in your personal space, no need to worry. You can clone the space, change the ownership to pseudolab, and add it to the collection following the same procedure.

title: Notebooks for live-coding
text:
한국어 버전
Templates of all tutorials — .ipynb notebooks with code removed — are available at:
https://github.com/NASA-Openscapes/2021-Cloud-Hackathon/tree/main/tutorials-templates.
Please open these tutorial templates in our JupyterHub to follow along and live-code with the tutorial lead.

title: 2023 Everyday AI Hackathon
text:
01_Joining Discord
Welcome to the hackathon! First things first, please follow the link below to join our community server and drop a greeting!






https://hf.co/join/discord





I Can’t See the Hackathon Channel!
If you’re new to the server, you’ll need to add the Open Source ML role to dive into the diverse conversations happening in the krew23-hackathon channel. Your involvement will undoubtedly elevate the energy and creativity here.



What Should Be My First Message?
Your initial engagement with the community can leave a lasting impression. Start by introducing yourself in the krew23-hackathon channel. Sharing your expertise, objectives for this hackathon, and the qualities you’re seeking in potential team members can help others understand and connect with you better.

Additionally, don’t hesitate to contribute to other participants’ threads. Share your feedback on their ideas and engage in thorough exchanges of thoughts as you collaborate on projects.


Any Further Questions?
Should you have any inquiries, feel free to reach out directly to the administrators listed below for immediate assistance.

@wonhseo
@gabriely1004
@jungnerd

Now, you are an integral part of this hackathon’s epicenter, the community. Never underestimate how your participation and communication enrich this communal experience. We support your new venture wholeheartedly!

title: 2023 Everyday AI Hackathon
text:
Tutorial Overview
Welcome to the first page of your journey. This guide is designed to provide you with the information necessary for the Hugging Face KREW Hackathon 2023.
We intend to briefly guide you through the processes from the initiation of your project to submission and evaluation, step by step. Please use this page as a reference material while preparing for the hackathon!

01. Before You Start: Checking the Prerequisites

Joining the communication channels
Team-building guide



02. Project Initiation: Taking the First Step

How to sign up for Hugging Face
Registering as a Pseudo Lab contributor
Project registration and setup



03. Project Submission and Evaluation: Enhancing the Value of Your Outputs

Ways to contribute to the project
Guidelines for communication and collaboration with the community
Submission of the completed project



04. Concluding the Hackathon: The Journey’s End (Scheduled for release on Oct 22nd)

Procedure for the issuance of completion certificates
Sharing participants’ feedback and reflections
Post-hackathon activities and opportunities

This curriculum is structured to give you a basic understanding of the process needed to complete the hackathon.
We hope this hackathon contributes to your technical growth and creative advancements. Let’s collaboratively craft an extraordinary experience through this hackathon. Best of luck!

title: 2023 Everyday AI Hackathon
text:
Introduction
Welcome to the Hugging Face KREW Hackathon!
This hackathon is for everyone who shares a love for Hugging Face, a platform to showcase your passion and creativity. Please read through the guidelines carefully and join us in this journey of collective growth.

1. How Does It Work?
Participating in the hackathon is easy! Just follow these 4 steps carefully:

  
    
    
    Join Discord
  
  
    
    
    Create a Project
  
  
    
    
    Contribute & Submit
  
  
    
    
    Completion & Beyond
    
    (in writing)
  


Join Discord: Stay updated with the hackathon news, form a team, or meet new friends by joining our vibrant Discord community!
Create a Project: Upload your working project demo to the Hackathon Collection, and showcase your creativity to the world!
Contribute & Submit: Enhance your project, share ideas through Pull Requests on the Hub, and learn along with the community. Your growth empowers the community. Check your popularity on the Leaderboard!
Completion & Beyond: After successfully finishing the hackathon, if you wish to meet in person, submit your team information and project URL through Event-us, and await the confirmation email!








Unauthorized use of someone else’s work will result in disqualification.
Ensure that your project description and demo are descriptive.






2. Rewards & Benefits

Support with HF credits (until November 11)
Hackathon completion certificate (example)
Numerous networking opportunities
Exclusive perks for offline event attendees (details to be announced)



3. Offline Event
Contributors with the most “Likes” on their projects will be invited to PseudoCon, where you can share demos and network. More details are available on the offline event application page.


4. Key Dates



Schedule
Date




Hackathon Starts
October 20 (Fri)


Certificate Issuance Deadline
November 10 (Fri) Midnight


Individual Offline Invites
November 6 (Mon) - November 9 (Thurs)


Hugging Face Local Meetup w/ PseudoCon
November 11 (Sat)






5. Hackathon Goals
The Everyday AI Hackathon emphasizes:

Participation from everyone, regardless of prior experience,
Creating a community where we can all learn and grow together.

Let’s engage in the krew23-hackathon thread, sharing creative ideas, and enhancing our skills.
We count on your active interest and participation. Let’s build a supportive community that grows and encourages together. Thank you!
